The four great elements and their derivatives are impermanent, not strong, not ultimate, not solid, not powerful, and quickly decaying. They cannot be trusted.
They are full of suffering, full of trouble, and a mass of various illnesses. Therefore, all of you, long-lived ones!
The mind has no basis and is also not created.
All of you, long-lived ones!
You should study these dharmas in this way. This eye is like a mass of foam, which cannot be grasped;
The eye is like a floating bubble, which cannot last long;
The eye is like a mirage, born from karmic afflictions and craving;
The eye is like a plantain tree, which is without substance in its nature;ğŸ”½The eye is like an illusion, arising from delusion;
The eye is like a dream, which is seen as false;
The eye is like an echo, which is dependent on conditions;
The eye is like a reflection, which appears due to karma;ğŸ”½The eye is like floating clouds, which are momentarily separated;
The eye is like a flash of lightning, which quickly disappears;
This eye has no owner, like the earth; this eye has no self, like water; this eye has no sentient beings, like fire; this eye has no life, like wind; this eye has no person, like space;
this eye is unreal, with the four elements as its home;
this eye is empty by nature, apart from the grasped and the grasper;
this eye is without cognition, like grass, trees, tiles, and pebbles;
this eye is without action, turning due to the power of the wind;
this eye is empty, filled with impurities;
this eye is false and deceptive, though it may be treated and adorned, it will eventually return to destruction;
this eye is like a pit or a well, oppressed by old age;
this eye ultimately has no fixed place, and in the end will return to death.
Elders!
You should know that the eye is like this, and the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are also thus. In brief, all dharmas should be known in this way.
All foolish ordinary beings give rise to attachment to all desirable things, namely, eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects.

Moreover, they give rise to attachment to the form aggregate, feeling aggregate, perception aggregate, mental formation aggregate, and consciousness aggregate, the eye element, form element, eye-consciousness element, up to the mind element, dharma element, and mind-consciousness element, the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element. They give rise to attachment to all desirable things, up to all named and formed dharmas.
Therefore, all of you elders!

You should not give rise to attachment to desirable things, namely, wives, children, houses, property, and treasures. Do not give rise to craving and grasping. You should give rise to pure faith and leave home to go forth.

Having gone forth, they do not give rise to desire. Because they have no desire, they perfect pure precepts and cultivate the pure practice of the PrÄtimoká¹£a, perfecting the pure and white Dharma and rules of deportment, and even with regard to minor offenses they are greatly afraid.
Elders!
If one studies in this way, one will attain the perfection of precepts.
Because of the perfection of precepts, one does not grasp at eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, mind, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, or dharmas.

The form aggregate, feeling aggregate, perception aggregate, mental formation aggregate, and consciousness aggregate are not grasped at. The eye element, form element, eye-consciousness element, up to the mind element, dharma element, and mind-consciousness element are not grasped at.
The earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are not grasped at.
In brief, all those dharmas are not grasped at.
Because of non-grasping, there is no loss.
What dharma is there no loss of?
Namely, the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are not lost.
The form aggregate, feeling aggregate, perception aggregate, mental formation aggregate, and consciousness aggregate are not lost.
The eye element, form element, eye consciousness element, up to the mind element, dharma element, and mind consciousness element are not lost.
The earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are not lost.
If these dharmas are not lost, then they are not defiled.
Because they are not defiled, one quickly attains lightness and comfort.
What is lightness and comfort?
It is called seeing nothing.
If one sees nothing, then in all directions there are no phenomena that create obstacles.
If there are no obstacles, then one does not harm oneself, one does not harm others, and one does not harm either oneself or others.
Because of being harmless, the mind is not destroyed, and one is able to enter that pure nirvÄá¹‡a without remainder.
Moreover, all you elders!
What is meant by entering? What is entered?
It is not entered by the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.
Moreover, all you elders!
If one grasps the eyes as formed from conditions, then one is attached to self and what belongs to self, and is separated from nirvÄá¹‡a.
How is one separated from nirvÄá¹‡a?

It is because of greed that one is separated from nirvÄá¹‡a, because of anger that one is separated from nirvÄá¹‡a, because of delusion that one is separated from nirvÄá¹‡a, because of ignorance that one is separated from nirvÄá¹‡a.
All you elders!
The ignorant are not separated from the past, not separated from the future, not separated from the present, and definitely have no wisdom, being separated from the wisdom that is produced.
What is called wisdom?
It is called the wisdom of exhaustion.
What is called the wisdom of exhaustion?
It is the wisdom of exhaustion in the past, the wisdom of exhaustion in the future, and the wisdom of exhaustion in the present.
It arises from the non-knowledge and separation from knowledge of dharmas.
That non-knowledge and separation from knowledge are the eyes arising from conditions and separation from knowledge.
The eyes are without self. If there is no self, then there is no grasping. If there is no grasping, then there is no rejection. If there is no rejection, then there is liberation.
What is liberation?

It is liberation from the grasping of self, liberation from the grasping of sentient beings, liberation from the grasping of life, liberation from the grasping of person, liberation from the grasping of annihilation and permanence, liberation from all grasping, liberation from discriminating grasping.
When there is no more discrimination, then there is no more discriminating subject or object.
Dharmas are without discrimination and are not apart from discrimination.
What is non-discrimination?
It is the non-discrimination of self and what belongs to self.
If there is no discrimination of self, then there is no grasping or rejection. If there is no grasping or rejection, then one enters liberation.
Whether dharmas are bound or unbound, one can attain liberation.
What is one liberated from?
It is liberated from all suffering.
All of you, headmen!
You should seek such a way of liberation.
But within this, there is no dharma that can be grasped.
Why is it so?
If there is something to be grasped, then fear arises.
At that time, the World-Honored One, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
Because of grasping at dharmas, fear arises; due to fear, one will fall into evil destinies.
If one sees the cause of fear arising in this way, it is because of the recognition of dharmas that grasping arises.
If one is able to contemplate the correct path in accordance with principle, the light of wisdom will destroy all darkness.
Because of seeing, one will attain the bright wisdom of superior understanding; one should know that different natures cannot be obtained.
One should carefully contemplate all empty places; movement and falsehood are not real.
In this, do not create a door of peace and happiness; because craving and love deceive the world.
Truly understanding empty dharmas, knowing that all dharmas are empty and unreal,
I have attained the gate of peace and happiness, free from worry, and also attained the immovable, supreme bliss.
If one can correctly understand in this way, one will know that all dharmas are empty,
And thereby be liberated from the causes of suffering, so disputes and arguments have no basis.
Because of desires, attachment arises; due to attachment, afflictions arise.
Attachment is also called grasping; due to grasping, the three existences arise.
Because of existence, birth exists, and thus there is cyclic existence; when the three existences cease, there is no birth.
Old age, sickness, and death also become nonexistent, and one ultimately does not experience impermanent suffering.
Know that without desire, there is no grasping; without grasping, the three existences do not exist.
When existence ceases, there is no birth; old age, sickness, and the suffering of death are all not experienced.
Therefore, you all, the elders, should together give rise to the mind of abandoning attachment,
Abandoning the loved ones and causes of attachment, they will quickly perfect the appearance of bhiká¹£us.
In terms of knowledge, wealth, and all desires, they should be content with each other,
Humble and respectful in all places, with a humble mind, increasing good benefits for others in all directions.
Do not give rise to the thought of guarding one's own precepts, do not look at others as breakers of precepts,
In terms of the characteristics of precepts, upholding and violating, do not slander others as violators.
Like a wild deer falling into a snare, one should know that they are harming themselves,
The harm of the mind bound by MÄra's rope is also like this, harming others by slandering is also like this.
The foolish give rise to various harmful intentions, praising themselves and slandering others is a grave fault,
Even those with broken precepts should refrain from slander, how much more so for those with pure conduct and precepts.
The assembly of sages with wisdom and courage, always cultivating the practice of seclusion and tranquility,
Abandoning body and life without a mind of attachment, diligently seeking the liberation of the tranquil Dharma.
The various non-Buddhist paths and their scriptures, all the roots of no benefit are completely abandoned,
Loving and delighting in the profound correct Dharma gate, that Dharma proclaims the principle of emptiness.
The fundamental place of the mind should be known as the twelve internal and external sense bases,
From them arise the causes of various karmic actions, the place where karma abides for a long time is called the mental factors.
The two conditions of the eye faculty and form objects, the eye consciousness arises with the three conditions,
If they do not combine and disperse, it is like the principle of fire without fuel.
In this way, all dharmas that arise mutually combine and therefore arise,
The doer and the experiencer are both non-existent, the correct path always manifests all activities.
The body formed by internal and external dharmas, in this one should know the emptiness of self and dharmas,
Fools, with their inverted and attached minds, do not know the self and what belongs to the self.
There is no inner eye that can exist, and externally it is also not obtained.
There is no self, no creator, and no enduring being; one should know that all dharmas are also like this.
The eye does not universally think to seek liberation, and so it is with the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
Form and so forth have no turning and no gate of creation; one should contemplate that all dharmas are also like this.
When the water of the great ocean rises and gathers, it temporarily produces foam but is not real.
Contemplate the eye and so forth in the same way; they have no solidity and no power, like foam.
The nature of the five aggregates is provisionally combined, like that foam which has no solidity or power.
Liberate all the gates of disturbance, as well as the worries of birth, old age, and so forth.
Having gone forth in my teaching, understand that all dharmas are like illusions,
Not in vain receiving their offerings of faith, they are able to make offerings to the Buddhas of the ten directions.

At that time, the five hundred elders heard the Buddha proclaim the profound true Dharma, and thus in this very place on the road, they became free from dust and defilements, and attained the pure Dharma eye.

It is like white cloth that is unmixed with black, easily accepting dye. These five hundred elders, in this very place, became free from dust and defilements, and their Dharma eye became pure, also like this.
At that time, the World-Honored One again proclaimed the essential Dharma for the five hundred elders, teaching, benefiting, and delighting them.
The Buddha said:
All elders!
The eye is extremely blazing.
How is it blazing?

It is said that this Dharma is suffering for oneself, with the blazing fires of craving, anger, and delusion, and the blazing fires of birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are also blazing.
How is it blazing?

Namely, the blazing fires of greed, anger, and delusion, and the blazing fires of birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress. I say this Dharma is one that brings suffering upon oneself.
The blazing fire of the sense object of form.
What is meant by blazing?
Namely, the blazing fires of greed, anger, and delusion. The blazing fires of the sense objects of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are also like this.
Moreover, all you elders!
The blazing fire of the aggregate of form.
What is meant by blazing?
Namely, the blazing fires of greed, anger, and delusion.
The blazing fires of the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are also like this.
The meaning of the eighteen elements is also the same.
Moreover, all you elders!
The blazing fire of the earth element.
Namely, the blazing fires of greed, anger, and delusion.
The blazing fires of the water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are also like this.

Namely, the blazing fire of greed, the blazing fire of anger, and the blazing fire of delusion. The blazing of birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are also like this. I say this Dharma is to experience suffering and distress oneself.
Furthermore, elders!
The eyes should not grasp at anything, and one should train accordingly. The ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind should also not grasp at anything.
Forms should not be grasped at, and sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, and dharmas should also not be grasped at. One should train accordingly.
Moreover, elders!

The form aggregate should not be grasped at, and the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, the consciousness aggregate, and the eighteen elements should all not be grasped at. One should train accordingly.
Moreover, elders!

The earth element should not be grasped at, and the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element should also not be grasped at. One should train accordingly.
Moreover, elders!
This realm should not be grasped at, and the other realm should also not be grasped at. One should train accordingly.
Furthermore, elders!
If the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not grasped, then there is no reliance.
If forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, and dharmas are not grasped, then one attains non-reliance amidst the sense bases.
Moreover, all you elders!

The form aggregate, feeling aggregate, perception aggregate, mental formation aggregate, and consciousness aggregate, as well as the eighteen elements, are not grasped, so one attains non-reliance amidst the aggregates and elements.
Moreover, all you elders!
The earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are not grasped, so one attains non-reliance amidst the six elements.
Moreover, all you elders!
This world and other worlds are not grasped, so one attains non-reliance amidst all worlds.
Moreover, all you elders!
If all dharmas are not grasped, then one attains non-reliance amidst all dharmas.
All you elders!

All dharmas are not attained and also not non-attained. If one can understand non-attainment and non-non-attainment, then one can be liberated from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress. I say this is liberation from all suffering.
At that time, the World-Honored One, wishing to restate and clarify this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
This world is extremely ablaze, with the two fires of birth and death constantly burning,
Without rescue, afflicting and tormenting foolish people, only the Dharma of the noble path is eternally extinguished.
What Dharma illuminates the world?
Now the Buddha, the Tathagata, has appeared in the world. In a single moment, he observes the gate of the right path and arouses diligence that is always firm.
One should observe that all dharmas are without support. The light of wisdom sees through the darkness.
Seeing thus, one attains the light of supreme wisdom. One should know that different natures are unattainable.
If one can observe without support, understanding that all dharmas are empty,
Thus understanding the Dharma gate of emptiness, the empty mind of enlightenment has nothing.
One should know that the dharmas of greed, anger, and delusion, these three blazing fires are extremely fierce and evil,
Universally burning the life of the world, long dwelling in sleep, the foolish are unaware.
All birth, old age, sickness, and death, worries, sorrows, and suffering always oppress,
One should know that they disturb the worlds, all those dharmas have no support.
At that time, the five hundred elders heard the Buddha's teaching of this true Dharma, their minds opened up and they understood. They came forward and said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!

Welcome, monks!
